content.raw:

content.raw: @scpeters , this is ready for review, in case you want to reduce a bit the number of emails you've been getting from Jenkins :wink:

content.raw: I'm a little confused by this comment, since the `containerMoved` variable isn't referenced in the following expectations. Maybe it's `EXPECT_LE` since it can move or not, but if it does move, then it must be in the specified direction?
content.html: I'm a little confused by this comment, since the containerMoved variable isn't referenced in the following expectations. Maybe it's EXPECT_LE since it can move or not, but if it does move, then it must be in the specified direction?

content.raw: What happens is that when I test it locally it moves, so I could `EXPECT_LT`, but on Jenkins it doesn't move (I'm not sure why yet), so I could `EXPECT_EQ`
content.html: What happens is that when I test it locally it moves, so I could EXPECT_LT, but on Jenkins it doesn't move (I'm not sure why yet), so I could EXPECT_EQ

content.raw: ok, that's what I thought, but it wasn't clear from the comment
content.html: ok, that's what I thought, but it wasn't clear from the comment
